metadata.title: CVE-2009-5144 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
mod-gnutls does not validate client certificates when "GnuTLSClientVerifyrequire" is set in a directory context, which allows remote attackers tospoof clients via a crafted certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2009-5144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-gnutls - 0.5.10-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mod-gnutls package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.5.10-1').
